flixel.util.FlxMath

type
class
A class containing a set of math-related functions.

Static Variables

MAX_VALUE(inline,null) : Float

Maximum value of a floating point number.

MIN_VALUE(inline,null) : Float

Minimum value of a floating point number.

Static Methods

inline bound(Value : Float, Min : Float, Max : Float) : Float

parameters
Value Any number.
Min Any number.
Max Any number.
returns
The bounded value of the number.
Bound a number by a minimum and maximum. Ensures that this number is no smaller than the minimum, and no larger than the maximum.

computeVelocity(Velocity : Float, Acceleration : Float, Drag : Float, Max : Float) : Float

parameters
Velocity Any component of velocity (e.g. 20).
Acceleration Rate at which the velocity is changing.
Drag Really kind of a deceleration, this is how much the velocity changes if Acceleration is not set.
Max An absolute value cap for the velocity (0 for no cap).
returns
The altered Velocity value.
A tween-like function that takes a starting velocity and some other factors and returns an altered velocity.

inline distanceBetween(SpriteA : flixel.FlxSprite, SpriteB : flixel.FlxSprite) : Int

parameters
SpriteA The first FlxSprite
SpriteB The second FlxSprite
returns
Distance between the sprites in pixels
Find the distance (in pixels, rounded) between two FlxSprites, taking their origin into account

inline distanceToMouse(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite) : Int

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite to test against
returns
The distance between the given sprite and the mouse coordinates
Find the distance (in pixels, rounded) from the object x/y and the mouse x/y

inline distanceToPoint(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, Target : FlxPoint) : Int

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite
Target The FlxPoint
returns
Distance in pixels
Find the distance (in pixels, rounded) from an FlxSprite to the given FlxPoint, taking the source origin into account.

inline distanceToTouch(Sprite : flixel.FlxSprite, Touch : flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouch) : Int

parameters
Sprite The FlxSprite to test against
Touch The FlxTouch to test against
returns
The distance between the given sprite and the mouse coordinates
Find the distance (in pixels, rounded) from the object x/y and the FlxPoint screen x/y

inline dotProduct(ax : Float, ay : Float, bx : Float, by : Float) : Float

parameters
ax Vector X
ay Vector Y
bx Vector X
by Vector Y
returns
Result of the dot product
Finds the dot product value of two vectors

inline equal(aValueA : Float, aValueB : Float, ?aDiff : Float) : Bool

getDecimals(Number : Float) : Int

parameters
Number The floating point number
returns
Amount of decimals
Returns the amount of decimals a Float has

inline getDistance(Point1 : FlxPoint, Point2 : FlxPoint) : Float

parameters
Point1 A FlxPoint object referring to the first location.
Point2 A FlxPoint object referring to the second location.
returns
The distance between the two points as a floating point Number object.
Calculate the distance between two points.

inline inBounds(Value : Float, Min : Float, Max : Float) : Bool

parameters
Value Number to check.
Min Lower bound of range.
Max Higher bound of range.
returns
Returns true if Value is in range.
Checks if number is in defined range.

isEven(n : Float) : Bool

parameters
n The number to check
returns
True if the given number is even. False if the given number is odd.
Returns true if the number given is even.

isOdd(n : Float) : Bool

parameters
n The number to check
returns
True if the given number is odd. False if the given number is even.
Returns true if the number given is odd.

inline lerp(Min : Float, Max : Float, Ratio : Float) : Float

parameters
Min Lower bound.
Max Higher bound.
Ratio Defines which number is closer to desired value.
returns
Interpolated number.
Returns linear interpolated value between Max and Min numbers

maxAdd(value : Int, amount : Int, max : Int, ?min : Int) : Int

parameters
value The value to add the amount to
amount The amount to add to the value
max The maximum the value is allowed to be
min The minimum the value is allowed to be
returns
The new value
Adds the given amount to the value, but never lets the value go over the specified maximum or under the specified minimum.

mouseInFlxRect(useWorldCoords : Bool, rect : FlxRect) : Bool

parameters
useWorldCoords If true the world x/y coordinates of the mouse will be used, otherwise screen x/y
rect The FlxRect to test within. If this is null for any reason this function always returns true.
returns
true if mouse is within the FlxRect, otherwise false
Returns true if the mouse world x/y coordinate are within the given rectangular block

numericComparison(num1 : Float, num2 : Float) : Int

parameters
num1 The first number
num2 The second number
returns
-1 if num1 is smaller, 1 if num2 is bigger, 0 if they are equal
Compare two numbers.

pointInCoordinates(pointX : Float, pointY : Float, rectX : Float, rectY : Float, rectWidth : Float, rectHeight : Float) : Bool

parameters
pointX The X value to test
pointY The Y value to test
rectX The X value of the region to test within
rectY The Y value of the region to test within
rectWidth The width of the region to test within
rectHeight The height of the region to test within
returns
true if pointX/pointY is within the region, otherwise false
Returns true if the given x/y coordinate is within the given rectangular block

pointInFlxRect(pointX : Float, pointY : Float, rect : FlxRect) : Bool

parameters
pointX The X value to test
pointY The Y value to test
rect The FlxRect to test within
returns
true if pointX/pointY is within the FlxRect, otherwise false
Returns true if the given x/y coordinate is within the given rectangular block

pointInRectangle(pointX : Float, pointY : Float, rect : flash.geom.Rectangle) : Bool

parameters
pointX The X value to test
pointY The Y value to test
rect The Rectangle to test within
returns
true if pointX/pointY is within the Rectangle, otherwise false
Returns true if the given x/y coordinate is within the Rectangle

roundDecimal(Value : Float, Precision : Int) : Float

parameters
Value Any number.
Precision Number of decimal points to leave in float. Should be a positive number
returns
The rounded value of that number.
Round a decimal number to have reduced precision (less decimal numbers). Ex: roundDecimal(1.2485, 2) -> 1.25

inline vectorLength(dx : Float, dy : Float) : Float

parameters
dx
dy
returns
The length
Finds the length of the given vector

wrapValue(value : Int, amount : Int, max : Int) : Int

parameters
value The value to add the amount to
amount The amount to add to the value
max The maximum the value is allowed to be
returns
The wrapped value
Adds value to amount and ensures that the result always stays between 0 and max, by wrapping the value around. Values must be positive integers, and are passed through Math.abs
